text.0: Patients who in late middle age have smoked 20 cigarettes a day since their teens constitute an at-risk group. One thing they’re clearly at risk for is the acute sense of guilt that a clinician can incite, which immediately makes a consultation tense.
text.1: In a study of U.S. medical school graduates, 1979–2013, women were less likely than men to be promoted from assistant to associate professor and from associate to full and less likely to be appointed department chair. The sex differences have not diminished over time.
